dojg.description: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
dojg.meaning: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as

examples.japanese: (ksa).山田さん以外の人はみんなそのことを知っています。
(ksb).日本語以外に何か外国語が話せますか。
examples.english: Can you speak any foreign language besides  Japanese?

examples.japanese: (ksc).私には酒を飲む以外に何も楽しみがない。
examples.english: I have nothing to enjoy other than drinking.

examples.japanese: (a).私は日本酒以外の酒は飲まない。
examples.english: I do not drink any alcohol but sake.

examples.japanese: (b).我々の会社では現在オーストラリア以外の国と取引はない。
examples.english: At present our company is not dealing with  any countries but Australia.

examples.japanese: (c).アメリカ以外の国からも沢山研究者が来た。
examples.english: Many researchers came from countries other  than America, too.

examples.japanese: (d).原因はこれ以外に考えられない。
examples.english: I can't think of any causes other than this.

examples.japanese: (e).私は散歩以外にも毎日軽い運動をしている。
examples.english: I take (other) light exercise every day as  well as taking a walk.

examples.japanese: (f).ここで待っている以外ない。
examples.english: There is nothing to do but wait here.  (literally: There is no other way but waiting here.)

examples.japanese: (g).安い以外に何かいいことがありますか。
examples.english: Is there any merit besides the price  (literally: besides the fact that it is cheap)?

examples.japanese: (h).この分は少し漢字の間違いがあるが、それ以外は完全だ。
examples.english: This sentence (or passage) contains a few kanji  mistakes, but other than that, it is perfect.
[Door sign] Employees only. (literally: Entry  of those other than employees is prohibited.)

dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Noun
- 以外(のNoun)
- コーヒー以外(の飲み物)
- (drinks) other than coffee
- (ii)Sinformal
- 以外
- だafter Adjective な stem and Noun changes to である
- 勉強する以外
- Besides studying
- 高い以外
- Besides the fact that something is expensive
- 便利である以外
- Besides the fact that something is convenient
- 先生である以外
- Besides the fact that someone is a teacher
